intro: Galactodenia, commonly known as the milkweed of the genus Galactodenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature showy, tubular petals that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Galactodenia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
